agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Health TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Senfronia Thompson The chair may limit testimony time and the number of testifying witnesses to ensure consideration of posted and pending business, especially if testimony would cause the public hearing to extend into the next calendar day. HB 805 Parker Relating to access to certain investigational drugs, biological products, and devices that are in clinical trials by patients with severe chronic diseases. HB 938 Davis, Sarah | et al. Relating to the capacity of certain minors to consent to maternal health care. HB 1014 Martinez Relating to cardiopulmonary resuscitation certification requirements for certain food service workers. HB 1477 Price | et al. Relating to the use of grants under the emergency medical services assistance program and the distribution of certain revenue received by the comptroller. HB 1622 Oliverson | et al. Relating to the authority of a physician to provide and dispense and to delegate authority to provide and dispense certain drugs. HB 1782 Cortez | et al. Relating to a plan to increase the use of telemedicine medical services and telehealth services in this state. HB 1869 Klick Relating to the composition of the Governor's EMS and Trauma Advisory Council. HB 1879 Davis, Sarah Relating to the automatic enrollment of certain women in Medicaid and the Healthy Texas Women and CHIP perinatal programs. HB 2009 Wilson | et al. Relating to the regulation of certain direct sales of food to consumers and a limitation on the fee amount for certain permits. HB 2057 Zerwas Relating to supportive palliative care in the provision of home and community support services. HB 2108 Rodriguez | et al. Relating to the regulation of cottage food production operations. HB 2610 Lambert Relating to expedited licensing procedures for certain nurses who are military spouses. HB 2766 Zerwas Relating to electronically prescribing controlled substance prescriptions under the Texas Controlled Substances Act; authorizing a fee. HB 2783 Wilson | et al. Relating to the establishment of the Pediatric Acute-Onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome Advisory Council. HB 2813 Price Relating to the statewide behavioral health coordinating council. HB 2815 Klick | et al. Relating to the licensing and regulation of genetic counselors requiring an occupational license; authorizing a fee. HB 2988 Meza Relating to a prohibition on the sale of prophylactics containing nitrosamines. HB 3017 Ramos Relating to nonconsensual pelvic examinations; authorizing disciplinary action. HB 3147 Parker | et al. Relating to a cancer clinical trial participation program. HB 3218 Thierry Relating to the regulation of e-cigarettes; requiring an occupational permit; authorizing fees; authorizing administrative penalties. HB 3468 González, Mary Relating to the operation of more than one ambulatory surgical center in a single facility. HB 3496 Sheffield Relating to financial investor disclosure and surety bond requirements for certain pharmacies; providing an administrative penalty. HB 3536 Rose Relating to the admission, examination, and discharge of a person for voluntary mental health services. HB 3538 Rose Relating to the establishment of the Opioid and Substance Abuse Advisory Council. HB 3672 Murr Relating to the collection and reporting of data on services provided by chemical dependency treatment facilities. HB 3704 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to certain public health data maintained by the Department of State Health Services and shared with certain local health entities. HB 3799 Buckley | et al. Relating to the advertising and labeling of certain meat food products. HB 3934 Frank Relating to the authority of rural hospitals to establish a health care collaborative. HB 3994 Bohac Relating to the availability of parking spaces at certain health facilities for persons with a disability; providing an administrative penalty. HB 4066 Beckley Relating to repealing provisions prohibiting a physician assistant from serving as a governing person or officer of certain business entities. HB 4147 Bell, Cecil Relating to required mental health awareness training for first responders. HB 4297 Raney Relating to the authority of physicians to delegate to certain pharmacists the implementation and modification of a patient's drug therapy. HB 4346 Lozano Relating to the regulation of off-site restaurant meal service operations: HB 4348 Phelan | et al. Relating to the authority of certain minors to consent to Texas Home Visiting Program services. HCR 137 Hunter Designating September as Suicide Prevention Month for a 10-year period beginning in 2019. Bills deleted after last posting: HCR 145 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
